Reviews.Content: Great hotel choice This was a wonderful little hotel in the heart of Florence. On a small little street not far from the train station and close to all the other sites and shopping in Florence. Very clean and good size rooms. We stayed on the 1st day we arrived in Florence and the last day before we left to go home. Both rooms were very nice. We arrived several hours before check-in both days and were allowed to check in early. The staff was very helpful and accommodating. The breakfast was very good and included in the price of the room. Will definitely stay here the next time we are in Florence.
Reviews.Author: landlbunch

Reviews.Content: City Love* My husband and I were there just a couple of months ago and had to change hotels because the one we booked online turned out to be terrible. So we walked around one morning and we stumbled upon a 3 star hotel, City Hotel - http://www.hotelcity.net/index.php and it was wonderful! We totally recommend to anyone that wants to stay somewhere comfortable but not pay a whole lot. You are right down the street from the Duomo and walking distance to everywhere! Breakfast is your regular meal with cured meats, cheeses, eggs, wonderful pastries and Dora, the evening receptionist was so kind and helpful! Definitely will come back and stay here again next time we visit!
Reviews.Author: shirlita

Reviews.Content: A Hidden Gem Very centrally situated in a little side street not far from the railway station. A delightful hotel which we would highly recommend. Immaculately clean throughout and room had everything you could need, including a fridge and air conditioning. Very comfortable bed. Windows had mosquito netting and double frames to eliminate any noise. Lovely breakfast and very friendly and efficient staff. All the main sites were within a five minute walk. Delightful. British couple aged 59/66
Reviews.Author: doctorTWilts

Reviews.Content: Great staff and location We were just looking for a good location, but found much more. The hotel was an easy walk from the airport shuttle or train station, with equally good access to the museums and the duomo. It looked tiny from the outside, but inside was surprisingly spacious, with colorful murals and a very pleasant breakfast room. The breakfast included warmed pastries (a nice touch), yogurt, cereal, fresh fruit, meats, and cheeses. When I asked for decaf coffee, I not only got my own carafe of coffee but also an equally large pitcher of hot milk! I loved it.  Francesco arranged our museum tickets and made terrific restaurant recommendations. Everyone at the desk was warm and gracious.  The only quirk was the shower. Our room (28) did not have a shower stall, just a curtained area that did not completely contain the water. More amusing than a genuine hardship, however. An excellent value for a Florentine hotel.
Reviews.Author: JoynearChicago

Reviews.Content: Italian Elegance at Hotel City We were so very pleased when we walked into this charming hotel! We had booked for the incredibly good location, the air conditioning and the private bathroom, in spite of the humble-sounding name. It was so much lovelier than we had expected! The entryway and sitting rooms are so pleasant, and one is taken by the lovely painted details in the vaulted ceilings. These modestly-sized rooms on the first floor also include a charming breakfast area with stained glass windows. Our room was clean and comfortable and had an antique desk. We visited during the height of the season during the last week of June, and this was an oasis. The staff was very helpful. As we left, I gave a letter to the person at the desk and asked him to mail it. It reached its destination right away!
Reviews.Author: GalileoCJR

Reviews.Content: Sleepless in Florence Very noisy. It was hot at night and the hotel staff refused to turn on the airconditioning.Six of us spent a sleepless night. Not at all worth the price you pay. The hotel staff was rude and unfriendly.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Nice Hotel, Great Location! We were staying in Rome and decided to do a day trip to Florence that turned into an overnight. We went without any reservations, but checked out our guidebook recommendations and tripadvisor reviews. We decided to try the Hotel City because it looked nice, had good reviews, and was close to the train station. When we checked in, we negotiated the price down from $140 Euro to $100 Euro/night, based on our guidebook price range (which we showed the desk attendant), the fact that we had the names of additional hotels, and (most obviously) because it was low-season. Our room was very nice and well-appointed by any standard. The bathroom was very clean and newer, but the shower was really just a curtain in the corner with a floor drain. Although it was somewhat unexpected in such a nice hotel, that was a fine trade-off though for a lovely room on a nice side street with excellent access to both the train station and the Duomo (and the rest of this very walkable city). The continental breakfast was fine. The only downside was that, when we asked to leave our bags until 6pm, we were told that there was no locked room, but we could leave them in the common area by the desk clerk. We stripped our bags of anything of any great value and left them without any problems.
Reviews.Author: TravelArtz

Reviews.Content: Not quite as pictured I was a little disappointed with this hotel; I had higher expectations after seeing the website. The room we had was okay and was clean. However, there was a vent pipe in the bathroom above the shower which led directly outside. We were kept awake during the night by street noises that came in through the pipe! However, on the plus side, this is an easy walk from the train station and fairly near the sites.
Reviews.Author: Genut

Reviews.Content: It's quite good The hotel is only 5 min from the train station and within 10 min from the Duomo. The staff is OK, helpful but I don't necessarily find them that friendly. Breakfast is on the weak side - the boiled eggs were cold and the pastries didn't look that good either. However, the room is spacious and clean.
Reviews.Author: swisstravel

Reviews.Content: Every reason to stay here! A very nice, clean, safe hotel on a desirable side road within walking distance of the central station. Duomo and Baptistery near walking distance, but far enough to avoid endless parade of crowds. The street noise has been abated via the use of new windows. A/C is available as a bonus. The front desk is handled admirably by the ultra competent Franchesca (who was also responsible for assisting with reservations to the Uffizi and Acc.) Daily breakfast was wonderful and consistent.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Very nice A very nice hotel. It was extraordinarily quite, with an air conditioning system that was the quietest I have ever run into. Bathroom was a little tight, but quite serviceable. Not in the very heart of the city but less than a 10 minute walk to the Domo. Very convienent if you are coming into or leaving Florence by train! I would gladly go back.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Best deal in Florence We went to the hotel City after we were dissatisfied with our hotel. It turned out to be the best deal in Italy! Three stars, amazing breakfast buffet, very friendly staff, great amenities, very clean and quiet. It was cheaper than most 1 star hotels in Italy and nicer than most 3 star hotels. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED...
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
